body: Pinot actually picked up the latest version of helix [last week](https://github.com/apache/pinot/pull/11450), though it won't have this change yet. But my question was more around what necessitated this feature, if you can share. Did you need on demand rebalancing for Pinot or for some other system?

> Just wondering, any particular reason why we want to change to debug level? From this PR [#2603 (comment)](https://github.com/apache/helix/pull/2603#discussion_r1302269166), it looks like the log is not frequent?

Actually, the problematic log is the other one and not the recovering log .. https://github.com/apache/helix/pull/2603#discussion_r1302269166.. as the other one gets publish for the whole duration until the partition recovers.

Delayed time window is configurable, I think setting up a small (or zero)
delayed time window resolves your problem?

Best Regards,
Jiajun

After an offline discussion we agreed on a couple comments for this design:
1. There is no need for the apis (start, close, and rebuild cache) in the MetaClientCacheInterface, as those methods are essentially done in the original MetaClientCache that such extends.
2. Instead, we will add a cache field to the metaclientconfig and the builder that will create an instance of the zkmetaclientcache if enabled.
3. There is also no need to expose the state of the cache to the user. The api contract is pre-defined and so whether the state of the cache is up-to-date or not is not needed.

Add support for setting a default InstanceConfig through HelixManagerProperty. This will allow InstanceConfig fields be able to have defaults while also allowing users to leverage autoJoin and autoRegistration.

Add support to persist all instance information collected by CloudInstanceInformationProcessor in CloudInstanceInformation object. Add ability for CloudInstanceInformationProcessor to produce full DOMAIN field instead of appending _instanceName unless last character in CloudInstanceInformation.CloudInstanceField.FAULT_DOMAIN is '='.

Source Issue: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HADOOP-16795 (Java 11 compile support)
Source Issue: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HADOOP-16795 (Missing Java 11 compile support in Hadoop)

Thanks, @himanshukandwal .  Hope that HADOOP moves forward and supports Java 11 soon. 
Do you anticipate any performance impact of moving back to Java 8 compilation for Helix?

> Thanks, @himanshukandwal . Hope that HADOOP moves forward and supports Java 11 soon. Do you anticipate any performance impact of moving back to Java 8 compilation for Helix?

Actually not really. The the compiled binary will run fine on consumer side. For Controllers, the JVM is v11, so features like G1GC (the thing we care about the most) will also run fine.

I am a bit uncertain about this change. Since we already have several apache Helix release using Java 11, changing back to java 8 may cause dependency issue for our users.  It may also not align with our document. (https://helix.apache.org/)
@xyuanlu , I want to get this fix in Pinot, wondering when this fix will be released?

+1 to what Xiaoyuan said. I'm fine if keeping it in branch but I don't
think we shall merge it to master.

Final commit message:
Add _deserializedPartitionCapacityMap to ResourceConfig model to ensure that the partition capacity map is only deserialized one time. This will lead to major performance gains as this was previously called in several parts of BestPossibleStateCalculation and CurrentStateComputation.
This test fails in: https://github.com/apache/helix/actions/runs/6565004659

This pr is ready to be merged. Approved by @desaikomal and @zpinto 

Commit message:
When adding/removing instance from a cluster, it is possible that at a point of time, instance config is gone but the INSTANCE ZNode is still there. This would cause config map in helix controller cache to have instance mapped to null config.
The failure is not a blocking error causing further pipeline failure but we would like to avoid noise in log.
This change add null check before access instance config.
@hivivo Hi Vivo, would you be willing to take a look at this PR? I saw that you built helix-front and would appreciate your expertise
